trans-unit.source: Getting started with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and Active Directory Federation Services
trans-unit.target: Getting started with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and Active Directory Federation Services

trans-unit.source: This is the Azure Multi-Factor authentication page that describes how to get started with Azure MFA and AD FS.
trans-unit.target: This is the Azure Multi-Factor authentication page that describes how to get started with Azure MFA and AD FS.

trans-unit.source: Getting started with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and Active Directory Federation Services
trans-unit.target: Getting started with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and Active Directory Federation Services

trans-unit.source: <html></html><linkText>Cloud</linkText><html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><linkText>Cloud</linkText><html></html>

trans-unit.source: If your organization has federated your on-premises Active Directory with Azure Active Directory using AD FS, the following 2 options for using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication are available.
trans-unit.target: If your organization has federated your on-premises Active Directory with Azure Active Directory using AD FS, the following 2 options for using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication are available.

trans-unit.source: Secure cloud resources using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication or Active Directory Federation Services
trans-unit.target: Secure cloud resources using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication or Active Directory Federation Services

trans-unit.source: Secure cloud and on-premises resources using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Secure cloud and on-premises resources using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: The following table summarizes the authentication experience between securing resources with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and AD FS
trans-unit.target: The following table summarizes the authentication experience between securing resources with Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and AD FS

trans-unit.source: Authentication Experience - Browser based Apps
trans-unit.target: Authentication Experience - Browser based Apps

trans-unit.source: Authentication Experience - Non-Browser based Apps
trans-unit.target: Authentication Experience - Non-Browser based Apps

trans-unit.source: Securing Azure AD resources using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication
trans-unit.target: Securing Azure AD resources using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication

trans-unit.source: <html></html>The 1st factor of authentication is performed on-premises using AD FS.<html></html> <html></html>The 2nd factor is a phone based method carried out using cloud authentication.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>The 1st factor of authentication is performed on-premises using AD FS.<html></html> <html></html>The 2nd factor is a phone based method carried out using cloud authentication.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: End users can use app passwords to sign-in.
trans-unit.target: End users can use app passwords to sign-in.

trans-unit.source: Securing Azure AD resources using Active Directory Federation Services
trans-unit.target: Securing Azure AD resources using Active Directory Federation Services

trans-unit.source: <html></html>The 1st factor of authentication is performed on-premises using AD FS.<html></html><html></html>The 2nd factor is performed on-premises by honoring the claim.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>The 1st factor of authentication is performed on-premises using AD FS.<html></html><html></html>The 2nd factor is performed on-premises by honoring the claim.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: End users can use app passwords to sign-in.
trans-unit.target: End users can use app passwords to sign-in.

trans-unit.source: Caveats with app passwords for federated users:
trans-unit.target: Caveats with app passwords for federated users:

trans-unit.source: App Password is verified using cloud authentication and hence bypasses federations.
trans-unit.target: App Password is verified using cloud authentication and hence bypasses federations.

trans-unit.source: Federation is only actively used when setting up App Password.
trans-unit.target: Federation is only actively used when setting up App Password.

trans-unit.source: On-premises Client Access Control settings are not honored by App Password.
trans-unit.target: On-premises Client Access Control settings are not honored by App Password.

trans-unit.source: You lose on-premises auth logging capability for App Password.
trans-unit.target: You lose on-premises auth logging capability for App Password.

trans-unit.source: Account disable/deletion may take up to 3 hours for dirsync, delaying disable/deletion of app password in the cloud identity.
trans-unit.target: Account disable/deletion may take up to 3 hours for dirsync, delaying disable/deletion of app password in the cloud identity.

trans-unit.source: For information on setting up either Azure Multi-Factor Authentication or the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server with AD FS see the following:
trans-unit.target: For information on setting up either Azure Multi-Factor Authentication or the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server with AD FS see the following:
